channel.title: Time-domain Astronomy on WFST
channel.description: Recent content in Time-domain Astronomy on WFST

item.title: Supernova
item.description: Supernova (SN) observations play a pivotal role in unraveling the mysteries of stellar evolution, the mechanisms underlying supernova explosions, the chemical enrichment of galaxies, and the fundamental physics governing our universe.

item.title: Tidal Disruption Event
item.description: The past decade has witnessed a groundbreaking development in transient research with the detection of an increasing number of Tidal Disruption Events (TDEs).

item.title: Multi-messenger Event
item.description: (1) Gravitational Wave Events a. Kilonovae Figure 1. The distributions of magnitudes of kilonovae at their maximum brightness and the corresponding times for BNS mergers with GW SNR 10.

item.title: Active Galactic Nuclei
item.description: Figure 1, Distributions of the apparent r-band magnitudes for spectroscopically confirmed quasars in the Stripe 82 (S82; red solid histogram; [157]) and in the SDSS 16th data release quasar catalog (DR16Q; blue dotted histogram; [158]).
